org.primaresearch.clc.phd.workflow.activity

Class BaseActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.primaresearch.clc.phd.workflow.activity.BaseActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HasLabels, Activity
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AtomicActivity, DirectedGraphActivity, ForLoopActivity

    public abstract class BaseActivity
extends java.lang.Object
implements Activity
    Base implementation of workflow activities
    Author:
    clc

      • addOutputPort

      • getLocalName

        public java.lang.String getLocalName()
        Description copied from interface: Activity
        Local names can be used to force several abstract activities within a workflow to be instantiated with one and the same concrete activity (same local name) or different activities (different local names).
        Example:
        Two OCR methods are to be evaluated. The abstract activities for the methods could get local names 'Method_A' and 'Method_B'. The activities for the evaluation, on the other hand, should both get the same local name 'EvaluationMethod' to ensure the same evaluation method is used for both OCR methods.
        Specified by:
        getLocalName in interface Activity
        Returns:
        The local name of this activity.

      • setLocalName

        public void setLocalName(java.lang.String localName)
        Description copied from interface: Activity
        Local names can be used to force several abstract activities within a workflow to be instantiated with one and the same concrete activity (same local name) or different activities (different local names).
        Example:
        Two OCR methods are to be evaluated. The abstract activities for the methods could get local names 'Method_A' and 'Method_B'. The activities for the evaluation, on the other hand, should both get the same local name 'EvaluationMethod' to ensure the same evaluation method is used for both OCR methods.
        Specified by:
        setLocalName in interface Activity

        Description copied from interface: Activity
        Returns the parent activity (e.g. a loop activity or a directed graph activity).

        Returns:
